alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 6:25PM CDT until May 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Henderson County in west central Illinois... Southwestern Mercer County in northwestern Illinois... Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Northern Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... Northern Van Buren County in southeastern Iowa... Louisa County in southeastern Iowa... Southern Washington County in southeastern Iowa... Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 625 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near New Boston to near Brookville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... New Boston, Keithsburg, Oakville, Toolesboro and Snively Access Campground around 630 PM CDT. Pleasant Plain and 4th Pumping Station Campground around 635 PM CDT. Ogle, Salina and East Pleasant Plain around 640 PM CDT. Seaton, Germanville and Round Prairie Park around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Lockridge, Mac Coon Access, Glasgow, Merrimac, Rome, Trenton, Mount Pleasant, Westwood, Water Works Park, Oakland Mills Park, Oakland Mills, Henry County Fairgrounds and Mount Pleasant Municipal Arpt. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington
